intro: Deiregyne chartacea, commonly known as the paperleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its broad, chartaceously textured leaves and produces clusters of small, daisy-like white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Deiregyne chartacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
